ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Movingâ€™s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.
Are aliens really out there? Discover the truth by rummaging through crop circles, pizza trucks, and more in this interactive hidden-object game.

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

editorialNotes.standard: With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

editorialNotes.standard: This spectacular collection by Zen Studios, the Jedi masters of virtual pinball, brings the Star Wars saga to life like youâ€™ve never seen it before. Based on the films, TV shows, and even iconic characters, each dazzlingly detailed game plays like a true labor of love. Beyond the brilliant table designs, the flawless physics faithfully recreate the mechanics of real pinball with stunning sights and sounds straight out of a galaxy far, far away.

This clever physics-based puzzle game challenges you to spray water to extinguish fires and manipulate the environment. Its simple, clearly defined mechanics allow for intuitive, satisfying puzzle-solving. New elements are routinely layered in, ensuring that the challenges stay interesting. Great visuals and impressive sound also set Sprinkle Islands apart.

editorialNotes.tagline: A deceptively deep game of survival
editorialNotes.standard: How do you build a kingdom? By galloping around and flinging gold at people, then seeing how they help you. Thatâ€™s the great thing about this deceptively deep survival gameâ€”how amazing you feel when you figure out everything from securing laborers to mounting defenses against monsters. And finding all the secrets (like a unicorn that drops gold) will keep you busy for ages.
editorialNotes.short: Charge into this captivating struggle to survive in hostile territory.

ios.subtitle: enjoy your Game on your Watch

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

editorialNotes.short: This stylish runner made a big impact when it first launched, and it's still a blast.
editorialNotes.standard: Race through a collapsing city in a game that helped launch the infinite runner genre. From its gorgeous music to its searing imageryâ€”exploding windows, falling buildingsâ€”Canabalt overflows with style and atmosphere. Surviving even a single minute requires split-second reflexes and a whole lot of luck. Plus, after years of updatesâ€”including all-new modes like shared-screen multiplayerâ€”this already epic game has been polished to perfection.

The virtual Rube Goldberg machines that make up Perchangâ€™s gorgeous levels are so lovely to look at that you might forget what youâ€™re here to doâ€”move marbles into their proper pipes. With contraptions ranging from flippers to conveyer belts at your disposal, this inventive 3D puzzler requires an intoxicating mix of skill, smarts, and laser-sharp focus.

editorialNotes.standard: Peek under roofs and rummage through spaceships to track down objects in this delightful time-hopping puzzler.

Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AIâ€”and learn a thing or two about yourselfâ€”in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.

Manage a fish tank of guppies.

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalancheâ€”the pressureâ€™s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the gameâ€™s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: One of the App Storeâ€™s early sensations, Doodle Jump HD has only improved with age. The superbly simple gameplay remains: tilt your device to hop up an endless series of platforms, blasting bad guys, grabbing power-ups, and making your mark on a global leaderboard. Hand-drawn visuals add quirky appeal, while an evolving mix of doodled worlds, special items, and whimsical characters keep this indie classic fresh.
